evidence: a Fourier series is built from sinusoidal components
each of these components is periodic
the Fourier transform of a sampled signal
continuous function in the frequency domain

triples.evidence: In the time domain, a Fourier series is built from sinusoidal components - each one a sine or cosine wave.
This tells us that in the frequency domain, we also get a periodic function.
triples.s: Fourier transform of a sampled signal

concepts.term: The periodicity comes directly from the fact that the Fourier transform of a sampled signal is made up of these repeating sinusoidal components.

triples.evidence: In the time domain, a Fourier series is built from sinusoidal components - each one a sine or cosine wave. And by definition, each of these components is periodic. Whether we have just one frequency or many, the result will still be periodic.
